summary: This document is the FY-2019 Annual Training schedule and attendance record for staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It details training sessions from March 4 to April 5, 2019, covering topics like ethics, PREA (Prison Rape Elimination Act), use of force, firearms, and security procedures. It includes attendance signatures for custody and administrative staff.

persons.name: Noel
persons.context: Listed as a custody staff member attending the annual training sessions on multiple dates in March and April 2019.

persons.context: Listed as a custody staff member attending the annual training sessions on multiple dates in March and April 2019, often appearing alongside Noel.

persons.name: Thomas
persons.context: Listed as an attendee in training sessions during the week of April 1-5, 2019, with the last name appearing on signature sheets.

persons.name: Michael
persons.context: Listed as an attendee in training sessions during the week of April 1-5, 2019, with the first name appearing on signature sheets.

connections.description: Both are listed as custody staff attending the same training sessions on the same dates, indicating they were colleagues at MCC New York.
Both names appear on the same attendance sheets for training in April 2019, suggesting they were staff members undergoing training together.

events.title: MCC New York FY-2019 Annual Training
events.description: Multi-week mandatory annual training for staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, covering ethics, PREA, use of force, firearms, security, and other operational procedures.

events.title: Firearms Training at FCI Danbury
events.description: Custody staff participated in firearms training and certification at the Federal Correctional Institution in Danbury, as part of the annual training regimen.

events.title: Firearms Training at FCI Danbury (Second Session)
events.description: A second session of firearms training and certification was conducted at FCI Danbury for staff, including a participant named Thomas.

locations: 26 Federal Plaza, 6th Floor, Classroom (New York, NY)
keyFacts: The document is a routine Bureau of Prisons (BOP) annual training record for MCC New York staff in early 2019, showing standard correctional training was being conducted.
Training topics heavily emphasized the Prison Rape Elimination Act (PREA), sexual abuse prevention, ethics, and use-of-force protocols.
Staff members Noel and Tova are repeatedly listed as custody attendees in March, while Thomas and Michael appear in April sessions.
Firearms qualification training for staff was conducted at an off-site location, FCI Danbury, on at least two dates.
The document itself does not directly reference Jeffrey Epstein, his case, or any specific incidents; it is an administrative record of standard prison operations.
